results.title: Communications
results.creator_credit: Art Babbitt, C Fouty and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personnel Management”.
Shows the need for effective communication in industry, not only in sales and production operations, but also in matters concerning the whole plant and its personnel. In the absence of authoritative information, rumours flourish sometimes causing serious tension among personnel, as illustrated in this film.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Art Babbitt, C Fouty and McGraw-Hill Films

results.title: Clash of opinion
results.creator_credit: Margaret Smith, Gregory Clegg and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personnel Management”.
Discusses the role of personnel management in industrial disputes. A dispute between management and members of a Transport Union is examined. A panel of directors of companies, trade unionists and personnel managers give opinions of how the dispute arose. Stresses the need for good communications between employers and unions and better education on negotiation for shop stewards. A good personnel manager can play an important day to day role in the creation of good relations between workers and management over a long period.

Helping the child face the don'ts

results.title: Helping the child face the don'ts
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Personality Development”.
Shows that personality is shaped in children by conforming to the “don’ts” imposed by parents and the society in which we live. Typical situations showing the child in relation to his environment are shown.

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personality Development”.
A combined forum version of three films in the Personality Development series: Baby meets his parents; Helping the child to face the don’ts; Helping the child to accept the do’s.

results.title: Baby meets his parents
results.creator_credit: Lawrence K Frank and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personality Development”.
Illustrates the concept that the baby is introduced to the world about him through parental provision for his biological needs. Three of the environmental factors influencing development are illustrated; the need for food, the need for unrestrained, normal elimination of body wastes and the need for protective care and love to foster feelings of security.

results.title: Infant cognition (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personality and Learning”.
An exploration of the development of the bond between mother and her baby. Using special filming technique it analyses sequences of what is known as per-speech, a recently discovered phenomenon where babies, even of a few days old, take part in adult-type conversations with their mothers.

results.title: Socialisation: the Dragon School, Oxford (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Richard Argent, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personality and Learning”.
Looks at the process of socialisation in the Dragon school, an Oxford preparatory school of some 600 pupils, mostly boys, but with 24 girls. Illustrates some of the values of the school, different teaching approaches and the attitude explicit and implicit to social control.
